Research Focus

Computational cognitive neuroscience researcher specializing in artificial intelligence, human memory modeling, and machine learning. My work focuses on high-dimensional vector spaces and computational models that simulate and inform our understanding of memory encoding, retrieval, and inference. With expertise in deep learning architectures, associative learning, and graph-based memory representations, I explore how different methodologies and theoretical frameworks can inform the structural dynamics of memory and cognition in both humans and artificial systems, contributing to the development of interpretable AI models and understanding of human memory.

Publications & Presentations

Society of Neuroscience Annual Conference, Chicago, IL.
